summary: Some criminal groups use a process called trade-based money laundering to hide their illicit funds. These schemes can include things like falsely describing goods and services in trade transactions. Schemes can involve many types of illicit activity that cut across multiple federal agencies' roles. But agencies don't have a formal way to share information about these schemes with each other or with the private sector...
title: Countering Illicit Finance and Trade: Better Information Sharing and Collaboration Needed to Combat Trade-Based Money Laundering
